snippet: Though observers feared the worst after Hurricane Sandy, biologists say there is remarkably little evidence that birds suffered mass casualties.
abstract: Satellite tracking studies, including one that coincided with Hurricane Sandy, show that migratory birds are skilled at managing weather by avoiding strong winds and correcting their course after being blown astray.
lead_paragraph: Though observers feared the worst after Hurricane Sandy, biologists say there is remarkably little evidence that birds suffered mass casualties.

headline.print_headline: To Birds, Storm Survival Is Only Natural
headline.seo: Birds Have Natural Ability to Survive Storms
headline.main: To Birds, Storm Survival Is Only Natural
